Row.Text: A 'We Love the King Day' begins in all cities whenever you capture an enemy city or adopt a new Social Policy. Cities celebrating 'WLtKD' always follow your State Religion and have increased [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People generation.

Our people are now divorcing their wives left, right and centre, and engaging in wreckless jousting competitions - sometimes at the same time! We're worried the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.

What only stands now in the way of our religious authority are those layabout monks who would remain loyal to their abominable heresies, and who would deny God's charge of I as Supreme Head of the Churches of England and of Ireland. They must, therefore, be suppressed by any means necessary.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be England (Henry VIII) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted from the beginning of the Medieval Era [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have enacted "Enact the Statute in Restraint of Appeals" [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All Monasteries in the empire are destroyed [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} {2_YieldType} [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{3_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Note: The {2_YieldType} and [ICON_GOLD] Gold rewards increase for every Monastery destroyed from this decision

What only stands now in the way of our religious authority are those layabout monks who would remain loyal to their abominable heresies, and who would deny God's charge of I as Supreme Head of the Churches of England and of Ireland. They must, therefore, be suppressed by any means necessary.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Lump sum of {1_YieldType} [NEWLINE]{ICON_BULLET]Lump sum of [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Enact the Statute in Restraint of Appeals

By the goodness and sufferance of Almighty God, with plenary, whole, and entire power, pre-eminence, authority... I, Sovereign of England, promulgate this degree that this Empire shall be governed by one Supreme Head and Sovereign having the dignity and royal estate of the imperial Crown, and that no person or persons shall appeal to any authority greater than the authority of the Sovereign of England, lest they shall incur the dangers, pains, and penalties therein.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be England (Henry VIII) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted from the beginning of the Medieval Era [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must not have founded a religion [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_ReligionReq} [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{2_Num} {3_YieldType} [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Founds a new religion, with the same tenets as those found in {4_ReligionType}
Henry VIII has declared himself Supreme Head of all religious matters within the {1_CivName}.
Failure to Produce a Male Heir

Our darling Queen has once again disappointed us with the bearing of a daughter. Whilst this daughter might have some use in the court of one of our friends, we need a strong, male heir with whom to ensure the continuation of our Tudor Dynasty and of our control over the English crown.[NEWLINE]
Marry this daughter off, rid my sight of this wife.
As her loyal husband, I can but only try again.
If only we could annul this marriage which is clearly false...
We have married off our new daughter, and sent our unhelpful wife to the chopping block.
As her loyal husband, we have pledged to remain faithful to our wife.
Regretfully, it is forbidden to divorce in our faith. What an inconvenience...
Our darling Queen has graced us with a son and heir with whom to continue the Tudor dynasty! God has seen fit to bless our endeavours, and we, His humble servant, are grateful.[NEWLINE]
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]All cities begin celebrating 'We Love the King Day' for {1_Num} Turns[ENDCOLOR]
A new heir has been born in these lands, and the Tudor dynasty shall live on.

Some foul miscreants have caused a rebellion in the city of {1_CityName}, in opposition to our assumption as Supreme Head of the Church of England. They are calling it a "Pilgrimage of Grace." If we are to preserve our new-found role as the highest and supreme authority on all religious matters, then we must crush this unrest swiftly and without mercy.[NEWLINE]
Let them riot. They'll learn that their efforts are ultimately fruitless.
We decided to let the rebellion in {1_CityName} die out naturally.
We have come down mercilessly upon the rebellion in {1_CityName}.
Religious unrest has broken out in the English city of {1_CityName}, over Henry VIII's assumption as Supreme Head of the Church of England.
